Concatenate without quotes

Source: R/general_cc.R
cc.Rd

Concatenates one or more inputs into a single string without quotes. Inputs can be unquoted symbols (e.g., variable names), quoted strings, numbers, or simple expressions. Useful for creating strings from variable names or data without including quotes.

Usage

cc(..., collapse = NULL, unique = FALSE, sort = FALSE)

Arguments

...

One or more inputs: unquoted symbols (e.g., A, B), quoted strings (e.g., "text"), numbers (e.g., 10), or simple expressions (e.g., 1:3). Invalid R symbols (e.g., 12a) will cause an error unless quoted.

collapse

An optional single character string to separate concatenated elements (e.g., "", " "or","). If NULL` (default), returns a character vector of individual elements.

unique

Logical. If TRUE, returns only unique values. Default is FALSE.

sort

Logical. If TRUE, sorts the result alphanumerically using gtools::mixedsort. Default is FALSE.

Value

A single character string with concatenated inputs (if collapse is a string) or a character vector (if `collapse = NULL“).

Author

Ahmed El-Gabbas
